did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Isaac Leon Kandel Papers,
did.abstract: Contains correspondence, writings and background materials relating to international education and Kandel's career as a leading comparative and international educator

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Isaac Leon Kandel papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984 with an additional increment in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Romania
M.A., University of Manchester, United Kingdom
Travelled to Germany to study with the Herbartian educational theorist Wilhelm Rein at the University of Jena
Moved to the U.S., New York

eventgrp.event: Lecturer at the Teachers' College, Columbia University
Assistant editor of Cyclopedia of Education

chronitem.event: PhD, Teachers College, Columbia University, dissertation titled: "The Training of Elementary School Teachers in Germany"
Researcher, Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching
Chair, History of Education, Teachers College, Columbia University
Editor of Educational Yearbook
Author, History of Secondary Education
Author, Comparative Education
Author, The Making of Nazis
Awarded a Doctor of Letters degree by University of Melbourne, Australia and the Legion of Honor Chevalier (Knight) by the French government
Member of the United States National Committee on Intellectual Cooperation
Author, Conflicting Theories of Education
Awarded a Doctor of Laws degree by the University of North Carolina
Editor, School and Society
Writer, editor and consultant for the United Nations and UNESCO
Part of the United States educational mission to Japan
Author, Education in an Era of Transition
First professor of American Studies at Manchester University
Author, Raising the School-leaving Age, series of six books issued by UNESCO
Author, The New Era in Education: a Comparative Study
Died in Geneva, Switzerland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, writings and background materials relating to international education and Kandel's career as a leading comparative and international educator.

The Biographical file and Correspondence series document Kandels work as a Professor and the chair of History of Education at the Teachers' College, Columbia University, a researcher for the Carnegie Foundation, an editor of School and Society and Educational Yearbook, as well as a writer, editor andConsultant for the United Nations and UNESCO. The Writings series provides further details of Kandel's contributions to the general field of education and to the specialized field of comparative and international education.

did.unittitle: Biographical file,

scopecontent.p: Includes appointments, invitation and awards, memoirs, and a series of oral history interviews. Also includes photographic portraits of Isaac Kandel

did.unittitle: Appointments, invitations, and awards,
The Reminiscences of Isaac L. Kandel, Oral History Research Office, Columbia University,
Isaac Leon Kandel (1881-1965): A Biographical Memoir by Lawrence A Cremin, National Academy of Education,
Photographs depicting Isaac Kandel and others (16 prints),
Correspondence,

scopecontent.p: Contains incoming and outgoing correspondence primarily relating to his career as a writer and educator. Correspondence organized alphabetically by name of correspondent

Bereday, George,
Carnegie Foundation,
Houghton Mifflin Company,

Universities,
A-W,
Columbia,
Harvard,
London,
Manchester,
Oxford,
Yale,
Writings,

scopecontent.p: Includes articles, speeches, book reviews, drafts and notes written by Kandel as well as material related to the articles, including correspondence, collected research and articles, and clippings. Additional materials included with an article may have a larger date range than the publication year. Writings organized by the creator alphabetically by title or subject.
